metadata.synopsis: Dialog which happens if you defeat Cazador without Astarion and outside the ritual. Ends with a decision whether to free, destroy, or trap the remaining vampire spawn prisoners.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Act 3 Origin Moments - Black Mass RitualUnchain Astarion from the party and leave him here.Move forward to Cazador.Defeat him in the battle.He will move to his coffin. Click on the coffin.

32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player opens the coffin lid to reveal Cazador lying in his coffin.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *The vampire lord lies before you, still as death.*

10.speaker: Cazador Szarr
10.text: These deathless dreams hold memories of a mortal life once-forgotten. Of the boy I was, the man I became, the monster that will not end.

9.speaker: Cazador Szarr
9.text: I sleep, but cannot rest. I live, but cannot die. I am eternal, and I grieve.

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *His dreams have the form of an endless ocean of blood, vast and unknowable.*

41.speaker: Cazador Szarr
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes the ancient dagger that Cazador holds, and plunges it through his heart. He wakes on impact,  looks at the player who killed him. Speaks his final words softly, as he turns to dust.NodeContext: Latin - 'It is finished - I fall.' (kon-soom-AH-toom est - E-go che-CHEE-dee)

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *The vampire lord is no more, but his legacy remains: seven thousand vampire spawn, including the stolen children of the Gur hunters. What will you do with them all?*
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up Cazador's staff, which is lying in the now-otherwise-empty coffin.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *The vampire lord is no more, but his legacy remains. What to do with the thousands of vampire spawn he created?*
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up Cazador's staff, which is lying in the now-otherwise-empty coffin.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Use the staff to set the prisoners free.

49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds the staff before them with two hands and focuses.

52.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see prison doors swinging open and vampire spawn taking their first tentative steps out of their cells.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: A herd of vampire spawn, unleashed on the Sword Coast. What could go wrong?

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: I didn't realise you had such a soft streak. Now it'll cost you. And the city as well, perhaps...
15.context: NodeContext: Disapproving (but not deeply angry - just thinks it was a bad call)

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: You did the right thing. All those deaths would have weighed you down.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: The spawn have their freedom - but what of the city, what of the lives they take? Gods, I can't imagine...

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: They have their freedom... but what of the city? Have we just unleashed a plague onto the streets?

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: Seven thousand vampire spawns, unleashed on the Sword Coast. It'll be a well-dressed flood of mayhem, at least.

55.speaker: Halsin
55.text: A wise choice. Let nature determine their fates.

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.text: I should applaud the liberation of bound creatures. But somehow I sense I will be the one cleaning up this mess.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: Fly, little vampires! Return to this city, and you will answer to BOO!
30.context: NodeContext: Minsc is only now realising the gravity of letting them all free - so he leaves them with this parting threat

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: Liberating them may be a salve to your conscience, but it is not a kindness. The city's poorer quarters will be their feasthall.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Destroy them with the staff's dark magic.

22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The prisoners in the cells scream and explode, sending a rain of blood down on us

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: Snuffed out in an instant, but to whose satisfaction? They will never feed and never be hunted. And never have a chance to hew their own paths.

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: Wise choice. Now the streets will be safer and you'll be stronger.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: All those lives, just snuffed out... I hope it was worth it.

4.speaker: Wyll
4.text: A merciful end. To lock them away forever would have been an unbearable agony.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Nothing remains now. Cazador and his machinations are naught but dust.*

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: So many dead... we'll never wash this blood from our hands.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: It's done. Just like that. Gods, help us.

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: All those lives snuffed out, just to grasp some power. That was craven - unnatural.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: A cold kind of mercy - but mercy still, I think.

21.speaker: Minsc
21.text: To end so many with only rhyming and words... the sword would have been messy, yes. But cleaner too, thinks Boo.
21.context: NodeContext: A little shaken by the ritual 'mercy-killing' of thousands of vampire spawn he just witnessed. They were beasts, yes, but even beasts deserve a death in battle.

37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
37.context: NodeContext: in awe, having just watched thousands of people die at the player's command. Impressed.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Destroy the staff so the vampiric prisoners can never escape.

39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player snaps the staff over their knee (or other method of destroying the staff)

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Eternally trapped - a damned existence all its own. Never to be predator, never to be prey.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Eternal imprisonment. Would have been kinder to just kill them.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: Gods, the horror of being forever locked away. The grave would have been a more merciful fate.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: Perhaps its for the best. Freeing them could have unleashed chaos, and the thought of killing them is more than I could stomach.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: This doesn't feel right. I don't know what else to do, but still...
60.context: NodeContext: Uneasy. Torn between a bad choice and a worse choice. Sad because it reminds her of her own situation of being trapped in Hell.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: This may keep the city safe, but to seal all those unfortunates away forever...? Death would have been more merciful.

31.speaker: Jaheira
31.text: Entombed forever beneath the city, starving and yet unable to die. True death might have been kinder.

13.speaker: Minsc
13.text: If they be innocent, they deserve life. If they be not - death. This hanging about in between... it is uncommon cruel.
13.context: NodeContext: Quietly disgruntled with our decision to keep the vampire spawn alive but imprisoned - almost pities them

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: They will gnaw at their own flesh before long, in an effort to fight off the hunger. It would have been kinder, and less cowardly, to kill them.
2.context: NodeContext: judgmental - player left thousands of vampire spawn imprisoned for eternity, and Minthara thinks this was cowardly and cruel. She's not sad, more annoyed with what she sees as a poor decision

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *The great vampire lord looks peaceful, recovering in his coffin. There is no trace of the fury that you fought against.*
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: players stand around Cazador's coffin, looking down at the sleeping vampire. His hands are crossed over his chest, and a dagger is held in them

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *The coffin lies silent, containing nothing but dust and memories.*
